SEARCH
Module HospitalManagementSystem
Package datastorage

Class AppointmentRecords

java.lang.Object
datastorage.AppointmentRecords
public class AppointmentRecords extends Object
The `AppointmentRecords` class manages the list of appointments and provides various methods to retrieve, modify, and manage appointments, such as getting available slots, retrieving appointments by status, and adding or removing appointments.

  • Field Details

    • lastAppointmentID

      static int lastAppointmentID
      The last generated appointment ID. Used to assign a unique ID to each new appointment.

  • Method Details

    • getAppointmentByID

      public Appointment getAppointmentByID(String appointmentID)
      Retrieves an appointment by its unique appointment ID.
      Parameters:
      appointmentID - The appointment ID to search for.
      Returns:
      The appointment matching the given ID, or null if not found.

      Returns:

      Parameters:
      date - The date for which to retrieve appointments.
      Returns:
      A list of appointments on the given date.

    • getEmptySlots

      public List<String> getEmptySlots(String date)
      Retrieves a list of available appointment slots for a specific date.
      Parameters:
      date - The date for which to retrieve available slots.
      Returns:
      A list of available appointment time slots.

    • getALLSlots

      public List<Appointment> getALLSlots()
      Retrieves all available appointment slots in the system.
      Returns:
      A list of available appointments with status AVAILABLE.

    • getDocAppointments

      Retrieves doctor appointments based on the doctor's user ID and the appointment status.
      Parameters:
      userId - The doctor’s user ID.
      status - The appointment status.
      Returns:
      A list of appointments for the doctor with the given status.

    • generateHourlySlots

      private List<String> generateHourlySlots(String date, String startTime, String endTime)
      Generates hourly slots for a given date within a start and end time range.
      Parameters:
      date - The date for which to generate slots.
      startTime - The start time of the range (inclusive).
      endTime - The end time of the range (inclusive).
      Returns:
      A list of time slots within the specified range for the given date.
